stages.logText: I found Tunlon, Crossglens sheep farmer, on the hill next to Crossglen. He asked me to help him get some wood for new fences. Since Crossglen doesn't have a lumberjack, I should go to Fallhaven and ask there.

I talked to Fallhaven's woodcutter. He told me that he had done a lot of work lately and therefore can't get any more wood for me. However, I should ask the woodcutters near Crossroads Guardhouse if they can help me.
The woodcutters told me that they have a lot of wood after clearing out the field around them, however all they have is firewood. Apparently this is not suitable for making fences.
I talked to Tunlon again and he told me to talk to his brother Tinlyn if he knew any person who could help me out.
Tinlyn was glad to meet me. He said that Loneford had a woodcutter who could mabye help me out.
Tinlyn wasn't really happy to see me. However, he told me to go to Loneford.
In Loneford, I met a villager who told me he had some spare fences made. I should bring them to Tunlon.
Tunlon took a close look at the fences I brought him but didn't like them a lot. The fence posts were too short he said. I should go back and ask for taller ones.
The woodcutter in Loneford however said he couldn't make any fences, as he just cuts the wood. He recommended giving Brimhaven's woodcutter a visit, as he thinks that he can do some basic woodwork.

I gave the woodcutter in Brimhaven a visit and he told me to bring some wood, so the craftsman can make fences out of it. Loneford's woodcutter should have plenty, so I should go back and ask him for wood.
I got a pile of wood for the fences.
Brimhaven's wood craftsman made me some nice looking fences. I gave him the gold coins from Tunlon.
Tunlon was happy to see the fences I brought him. These should be just fine, he said.
